userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The materials from Washington and Lee University Special Collections are made available for use in research, teaching, and private study, pursuant to U.S. Copyright law. The user assumes full responsibility for any use of the materials, including but not limited to, infringement of copyright and publication rights of reproduced materials. Any materials used should be fully credited with the source. Permission for publication of this material, in part or in full, must be secured with the Head of Special Collections.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p:
Preferred citation: [Identification of item], M. D. Irons Correspondence, WLu Coll. 0212, Special Collections and Archives, James G. Leyburn Library, Washington and Lee University, Lexington, VA.
In some cases the citation format may vary. Please contact Special Collections staff to verify the appropriate format.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Blue sheet prepared by Susan L. Gates (1/6/89)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of a single letter written by Eli F. Irons, a Union soldier serving in the 146th Regiment of the Ohio National Guard, out of Fayette, VA, to his wife, Mrs. M. B. Irons, in August of 1864. In the letter, Irons talks of his experiences serving in the garrison, and his desire to return home shortly.
